SEARCH

Package net.tangly.core.domain

package net.tangly.core.domain
The package defines the core abstractions for a bounded domain implementation. Entities defined in the domain can have oid, id, name, tags and comments. The realm interface is the entry point for the repository and factory abstractions. Repositories retrieve domain objects from persistence technologies. Factories create new object trees. The regular persistence approach is based on EclipseStore. The solution is well integrated in Java so that retrieval and creation operations are straightforward to implement.

The key abstractions are:

Bounded Domain
Defines the bounded domain model and the domain services.
Realm
Defines the repositories interfaces to retrieve all domain entities.
Port
Port interface for all inbound and outbound communication.

The user interface is an optional port. We support Vaadin based user interfaces.

The REST interface is an optional port. We use Javalin and OpenAPI to build a REST interface to the domain.

Creating a New Bounded Domain

Define Domain Entities
The domain entities are defined as regular Java classes and records. Interfaces defined in the package net.tangly.core simplify the definition of domain entities. Support classes are provided to define entities with oid, id, name, tags and comments. Reference codes should use the Code interface.

Per convention all classes are defined in the package Domain.domain.

Define the interfaces to the Bounded Domain
  • The bounded domain class Domain-BoundedDomain defines all the instances defining the bounded domain. It implements the BoundedDomain interface.
  • The realm DomainRealm defines the repository interface. It implements the Realm interface.
  • The port DomainPort defies the default port interface. It implements the Port interface. This interface defines the import, export and clear functions for the bounded domain.
  • The optional DomainBusinesLogic class defines business logic functions. It does not implement any specific interface.

Per convention all classes are defined in the package Domain.services

Define the implementation of all service interfaces

Per convention all classes are defined in the package Domain.ports.

  • Implement the realm interface. Per convention the class is called DomainEntities. Use the Provider abstractions to provide persistence with EclipseStore.
  • Implement the port interface. Per convention the class is called DomainAdapter.
  • Define the TSV Handler to enalbe the adapter to import entities from a TSV file and export them to a TSV file.

Realm

The realm persists domain entities and aggregates. The preferred approach uses EclipseStore to persist graphs of Java objects. The provider interface and their various implementation is a powerful mechanism to store and retrieve domain entities.

Port

The port provides the interfaces to the domain model for the adapters. Any bounded domain provides an import, export, and clear operations. The import loads an archive of all entities of the domain. The export archives all entities to a set of files. The clear removes all entities from the doamin. THe preferred import and export format is TSV>/p>

Per convention all interfaces are defined in the package Domain.ports.

TSV Import and Export

Utilities are provided in the Gleam module.

You can use the TSV import and export utilities to import and export entities from and to TSV files.

Business Logic

Complex business logic should be implemented in this class

Vaadin User Interface

The user interface of a bounded domain is optional. Use the BoundedDomainUi class as the entry point for the bounded domain specific user interface.

REST Interface

Domain Events

    Provides core abstractions used in any commercial application.
  • Class
    Description
    AccessRights
    Defines the access rights of a specific user to a specific domain.
    AccessRightsCode
    A user has different access rights for a specific domain or the whole application: nonehas no access to the domain. restricted-userhas only read and write access to owned entities in a domain.
    BoundedDomain<R extends Realm,B,P extends Port<R>>
    A bounded domain as defined in the DDD approach has a domain-specific model and a set of adapters.
    BoundedDomain.EventListener
    Defines a refined event listener interface to handle events in the domain or from another domain.
    Document
    Defines a document and its metadata stored in the system as immutable record.
    DomainAudit
    Defines the interface to audit relevant events specific to a bounded domain.
    DomainEntity<T>
    Define the meta-information describing the characteristics of a domain entity.
    Operation
    Defines the CRUD operations which can be applied on entities.
    Port<R extends Realm>
    Defines the inbound and outbound communication port to the bounded domain.
    Realm
    The realm is responsible for the handling of entities and value objects part of the domain model.
    TsvHdl
    Utility class to handle TSV files.
    User
    An application user can log in the application and access to domain data based on domain access rights.
    UsersProvider
    Defines a provider for the list of users and the list of active users for a domain.
